results.title: Product and Design Lead
results.description:
About Burq

Burq started with an ambitious mission: how can we turn the complex process of offering delivery into a simple turnkey solution.

We started with building the largest network of delivery networks, partnering with some of the biggest delivery companies. We then made it extremely easy for businesses to plug into our network and start offering delivery to their customers. Now, we‚Äôre powering deliveries for some of the fastest-growing companies from retailers to startups.

It‚Äôs a big mission and now we want you to join us to make it even bigger! üöÄ

We‚Äôre already backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists, including Village Global, the fund whose investors include Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, Reid Hoffman, and Sara Blakely. We have assembled a world-class team all over the U.S.

We operate at scale, but we're still a small team relative to the opportunity. We have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to grow while doing the most important work of your career.

We want people who are unafraid to be wrong and support decisions with numbers and narrative. Here‚Äôs a quick overview of what you will be doing:


Product Manager

As the Product Lead at Burq, you will work closely with co-founders, technical, and functional teams to manage the process of transforming feedback and ideas into concrete features and product enhancements in our existing platform. You will help to strategically continue building our product roadmap, identify gaps, utilize customer feedback, scope out features, and own the UI/UX design of our platform. You will be part of an emerging team that is helping our clients optimize their delivery operations, and have an immediate impact as the first employee dedicated to this function at a fast-growing, early-stage startup.

What You'll Do

    • Be one of the first 20 people in a growing company on an amazing team
    • Work closely with leadership and engineering to build out the product roadmap, set goals, and execute on project plans
    • Manage the delivery of new features from end to end, start from defining the problem through shipping and measuring success
    • Align with leadership and marketing functions to ensure new features are shared with and adopted by existing customers
    • Define visual UI for mobile and web. Focusing on UI, product branding, and content presentation.
    • Lead the initiative on UX and visual design to help evolve the design of our applications.
    • Rapidly create multiple solutions with sketches, prototypes, and wireframes.
    • Communicate designs and specifications in a reproducible/scalable manner.
    • Spend time talking to customers and analyzing feedback to inform product decisions
    • Play a key role in providing our customers with the best experience possible!

Requirements

Who You Are

  • 3+ years of experience in a product management role (bonus for product-led SaaS company experience)
  • Background working across engineering, design, customer success, and sales
  • Past experience communicating with customers to gather data about pain-points, and communicating that data with key stakeholders to evaluate against the product roadmap
  • Passion for running experiments, and using data-driven approaches to measure and track success
  • Experience writing PRDs and working with engineering teams to scope and workload balance
  • Prior experience with owning UI/UX design
  • An online portfolio featuring your web application, mobile, and any other relevant work.
  • Expert eye to detail for outstanding creative and visual design.
  • Have a go-getter attitude and thrive in the startup environment - you are not shy to experiment with new concepts and use data to validate success
  • Experience using JIRA, agile project management methodologies, and product management software
  • Are highly organized and able to adapt to changing priorities
  • Are a skilled listener & with excellent verbal and written communications

Benefits

About the Team

Owners: We hire a smaller number of high-quality, talented individuals and trust their judgment.

Builders: We are a very early-stage startup, which means there is an endless amount of opportunity to build! We value transparency and cross-collaboration when trying out new strategies, testing new ideas, and giving/receiving feedback.

Velocity: We move fast and with intention. We believe in transparency across our team in order to maintain our velocity and ensure we are not losing focus on the company. mission and vision

Long-Term Thinking: As a small startup, there are endless opportunities that we can tackle in our industry. To ensure we effectively scale and continue to be a market leader, we keep our team focused on our critical initiatives, and provide every team member with full-autonomy over their work in order to meet our long-term goals.

Benefits: We believe in investing heavily in our employees, and provide the below benefits to our team members:

  • Competitive compensation packages, including salary and equity options
  • Remote-First work environment
  • Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
  • Learning and Development Stipend
  • Work-from-home Stipend
  • Generous PTO

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: At Burq, we value diversity and take providing our diverse workforce with an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, martial status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Designer, NationSwell Studio
results.description:
Founded in 2013, NationSwell helps purpose-driven leaders and organizations take their impact to the next level. Our unique ecosystem of services and experiences provides influential leaders and organizations with essential strategy, connections, and amplification. NationSwell is a certified B Corp, which means how we do business is inextricably linked to our mission and impact. We hold ourselves accountable every day to the values of Integrity, Excellence, Inclusion, Innovation, Inspiration, and Teamwork.

The NationSwell Studio is the nation‚Äôs leading social impact studio. As part of the NationSwell ecosystem, the Studio is embedded in‚Ä® a unique community of purpose-driven leaders and experts, and we are committed to helping our partners take their impact to the next level through strategy, storytelling and audience engagement. Our sweet spot is distilling complex social issues into compelling human stories, moving influential audiences to action and centering impacted communities in all that we do. Clients include progressive corporations, leading philanthropies,and cutting edge nonprofits, such as AARP, Einhorn Collaborative, Greater Good Science Center, The Mission Continues, Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, Samsung NEXT, Schultz Family Foundation, Starbucks, TENT, and Toyota.

Role Overview
NationSwell is seeking a Designer to join the NationSwell Studio team to help create partner brand and campaign collateral design. This person will report to the Managing Director and will serve as the lead production designer for the NationSwell Studio. Qualified candidates will have a strong portfolio of visual design experience including (but not limited to) brand identity, layout, typography, web design, motion graphic content, and illustration.

As Designer, you will help design campaigns, brand identities, content and advertising campaigns, and event experiences for Studio clients, and help to shape NationSwell branded initiatives and the identity of the NationSwell visual brand.

Your work should be curious, inclusive, and brave ‚Äî striving for relevance, excellence and distinctiveness. You have a passion for design storytelling and know how to harness design to solve the complex problems that affect the human experience. You understand that great creative work requires great strategy and you always have rationales for your decisions. You have a passion for working in mission-driven fields, and you have an entrepreneurial spirit.

The annual salary range for this position is $70,000 - $90,000.

What will you do?

  • Work with many different facets of design including (but not limited to) digital/social, brand identity systems, typography, web design, motion graphics, photography, illustration
  • Use a variety of tools and techniques to create designs that not only look great, but are executed in meaningful ways to deliver quantifiable results
  • Design across a variety of styles/looks, as defined by the goals and guidelines of our clients and initiatives
  • Demonstrate an exceptional eye for layout, composition and UI
  • Work proficiently with design and prototyping tools and methods (e.g, Adobe CC, Sketch, Figma, etc.)
  • Help extract design needs from a wide variety of stakeholders, both internally and externally, in order to clearly define the deliverables, goals/objectives, milestones and successful outcomes of any given project
  • Conduct relevant research to guide the rationale behind your design decisions throughout the creative process
  • Experience in video production desirable but not required
  • Inspire your NationSwell teammates from other (non-Creative) disciplines, setting and maintaining the industry standards of creativity from concept to execution

What are you like?

  • Have a strong understanding of composition, color theory, typography, design history, and information architecture
  • Have a track record as a well-liked design leader for projects/campaigns that include design systems, audience experiences, and products that delight audiences/users and achieve business results
  • You don‚Äôt have a singular look to your work - you‚Äôre happiest as a shape-shifter who can create a unique design solution for client/project
  • Adept at guiding internal and external teams using rationales and persuasion, rather than inflexibility and impatience
  • Prioritize high teammate and client satisfaction with your design work and process
  • Display the consistent ability to clearly express yourself and have a strategic rationale for your creative ideas ‚Äî including having the confidence to present your work in a clear and inspiring way to internal teams and client partners
  • Enjoy monitoring the latest design trends from around the world in order to bring fresh inspiration to the creative team (and our wider teams) on a daily/weekly basis
  • You have a ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the note behind the note?‚Äù approach to feedback. You know that every note - whether or not you make the change - is valuable because it provides information
  • When you give feedback, you offer solutions, rather than merely identify a problem
  • A self starter who takes initiative and is not fearful of ambiguity ‚Äî offer creative ideas that the team and partners can respond to
  • Excellent organizational skills ‚Äî able to effectively manage deadlines, thinking 5 steps ahead, and prioritizing work
  • Embraces collaboration and idea sharing, open to feedback from all disciplines ‚Äî enjoys working with a small, in-house team paired with a roster of freelance specialists
  • Nice to have: experience or interest in inclusive and purpose driven design

Benefits

We know that having a positive team culture is essential to achieving our goals, so we put time and effort into making NationSwell an encouraging, energizing, and exciting place to work. We are proud to be a certified B Corp. Here are just a few of the ways we celebrate our staff and culture at NationSwell.

  • Health and Wellness: Health, dental, and vision insurance, an EAP, HSA, FSA, and other wellness benefits for you + your family
  • Family-friendly: Eight weeks of paid parental leave
  • Work-Life Balance: Unlimited paid time off and flexible schedules to encourage your work-life balance
  • Giving Back: Paid time off for employees to volunteer for causes that matter to them and internal moments to celebrate it
  • Remote Work Support: A stipend to help you set up your desired home office
  • Transit: A fully-covered Citi Bike membership and pre-tax transit benefits to help you get to where you‚Äôre going
  • Net Purpose + Culture Index: Measure of our employee‚Äôs sense of purpose and engagement with our Mission
  • Your Savings: Employees are offered a 401k account, and we match a portion of each contribution

NationSwell is committed to creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are dedicated to building a workforce that celebrates diversity and equity and believe that inclusivity plays an important role in our decision-making process, both in staffing and in work product.

results.title: Workforce Experience (WX) Designer
results.description:

Leapgen is a global digital transformation company shaping the Now of Work. We partner with enterprise leaders to better design and deliver workforce services and architect HR technology solutions that meet the expectations of workers and the needs of the business. Our areas of focus include HR Technology, HR Operations and Service Delivery, and Workforce Experience. Leapgen is founded on the core values of Love, Energy, Audacity and Proof. That means we

  • LOVE what we do, which
  • ENERGIZES us and our clients to do
  • AUDACIOUS things, and

We‚Äôre smart, but we don‚Äôt take ourselves too seriously. We think differently: transformation is constant, disruption should be healthy and strategic, and people and business are meant to be agile. As such, we encourage and expect our people to be innovative, to do different things. We challenge ourselves to stretch, adapt, learn and improve...constantly. Our customers will tell you we feel like a valued extension of their team because we are.

The Workforce Experience¬†Designer helps design experiences (interactions + transactions) that meet workforce expectations. In this role, you should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp client needs and collaborate with others to solve problems and continually improve. You will collaborate with Leapgen Consultants, our Clients and their software providers and implementation partners to help design frictionless experiences throughout the design thinking lifecycle - from getting to know and empathize with members of the workforce to iterating on ideas and recommending changes to processes and/or content to providing input on proofs-of-concepts and prototypes to be tested.¬†¬†¬†

The Day-to-Day Stuff

Qualifications

Education

Contract or Permanent; we can explore the right arrangement for all

Location & Travel

  • Up to 20% possible

How to get started: If you‚Äôre excited by the idea of seeing yourself in this role at Leapgen, please apply with your CV and a cover letter that best expresses your interest and unique qualifications. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Leapgen makes an¬†oath¬†to protect people in the workplace. We are committed to reducing conscious and unconscious bias and fostering a judgement-free workplace that celebrates diversity. Here are a few ways we put this into action:

  • We want you to shine through a great interview experience. When we reach out to schedule a conversation, we‚Äôll ask whether you require any accommodation to make that so.

  • We don‚Äôt seek culture fit; rather, we seek and welcome diverse ideas and perspectives that can enhance our culture, showcase new perspectives, and challenge our thinking. You can be you here.
